title: Scientific Inquiry Curriculum Based on Radar Electronic Warfare Countermeasure Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic radar signal processing concepts and intermediate-level electronic warfare simulation experiment experience
context.additional_context: A corporate technical competency enhancement program with BYOD-based simulation exercises. Focuses on developing electronic warfare response strategies using scientific inquiry methods.

learning_goals: Explain the operating principles of LFM pulse radar and the impact of electronic warfare jamming signals on signal modulation through scientific methods.
Perform simulations via experimental measurements for jamming signal detection based on RPIP signals and PPLFM signal design.
Implement an algorithm design project to separate target and jamming signals using sparse decomposition-based dictionary learning methods and conduct evidence-based analysis.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
